text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Being against evil doesn’t make you good.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I’m not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Eistein

text: Always do sober what you said you’d do drunk. That will teach you keep your mouth shut.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
author: Sĕnĕca

text: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
author: Mark Caine

text: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
author: David Brinkley

text: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Many of life’s failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas Edison

text: A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and gets to bed at night, and in between he does what he wants to do.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: Goals are the fuel in the furnace of achievement.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Listen to your intuition. It will tell you everything you need to know.
author: Anthony D'Angelo

text: They can do all because they think they can.
author: Virgil

text: Spring is a time for rebirth and the fulfilment of new life.
author: Byron Pulsifer

text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Learn all you can from the mistakes of others. You won't have time to make them all yourself.
author: Alfred Sheinwold

text: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just to realize them.
author: reams, just to realize them.
